How come?  It's a flaw in the JUnit custom class loader, not the JDK.

Scott S.
Macromedia 

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Morris
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 10/31/2001 6:42 AM
Subject: Re: [junit] RMI Classloading bug in TestCaseClassloader?

Scott Stirling wrote:

> Yep, same root problem (different symptom) as when you use JAXP
classes
> under the same conditions: the JUnit ClassLoader doesn't always
delegate to
> the parent when it should.


Thanks for the reply -- I found the answer in the list archives when
yahoo 
eventually became available again.  Evidently there is some hope that
the 
problem will become resolved/resolvable in JDK1.4.
